content: i trim it keeping the shape in mind how to arrange your fire i put the big log with no flames directly behind the log with flames to help it stand see figure c then i take the small log and place it diagonally to one side figure d if desired you can secure them in place by stitching them to each other i don t bother as mine are just for display tall mini bonfire instructions please note that if you plan to make a tall bonfire you will also need to make a small one to go in front main log make 1 cast on 5 sts knit 14 row of i-cord cast off hide both ends inside of log and trim carefully flames yarn you will need 5 groups of 3 thin strands of yarn roughly 12 /30cm in length see figure e you can use sock or fingering for this or for the wavy look you can untwist your thicker yarn s plies attaching i attach my yarn flames to the top middle of my log just like a fringe on a scarf shaping when done lightly lick the top of your thumb and first finger and twist the top a few times this should give the fire its shape you may need to trim it first i trim it keeping the shape in mind how to arrange your fire first make sure your small mini bonfire is set up next place your flaming log directly behind your small fire figure f i press my small flames against my tall flames to help them stand figure g i also lean my tall flames forward a bit if they are having trouble standing trim them want some unlit logs make some i-cords in various lengths and instead of using red sock yarn use dark brown sock yarn with your brown worsted pattern help thanks for choosing one of my designs for pattern support just pm me on ravelry 2 finishing photos figure a figure b figure c figure e figure d figure f figure g 3
